I have tried a couple of times to ask this question in their official forum and no one will answer. On their prebuilt planes i noticed that the Ailerons and elevators actually work together with the rudders. Lets say you hit the A Key, then a left Aileron will work simultaneous with with the rudder. NOT using the Q or E. This makes the planes you build actually controll like a normal plane should for turning. theoretically anyway

Thank you for the help.

EDIT: I found the answer, mods can delete this thread now thank you

Im not familiar with that forum, im new at this sorry. I mean i posted in their official forum where everyone is asking questions and having issues.

The problem- When you fly a plane and you want to turn, you Hit Akey to turn left. But only the rudder will turn. so you have to manipulate with the Qkey. On their prebuilt planes, you can hit the Akey and a selected flap( which now acts as an alieron) will work with the rudder to turn the plane. Im probably not making any sense

Edited June 5, 2013 by viperwolf

It makes sense to me. Do the pre built planes come with their home brew avionics package? Do you have SAS toggles as on?

You should be able to achieve the same effect completely stock if you have your control surfaces lined up in the correct locations relative to the center of lift. KSP tends to do that sort of calculating on its own.
